hypothesis_content.title: News-Induced Cross-Asset Decoupling
hypothesis_content.statement: When crypto-specific negative news hits during neutral/bull regimes, BTC-ETH correlation breaks down temporarily (24h correlation drops below 0.6), creating pairs trading opportunities with predictable reversion within 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Crypto-specific news often affects ETH more than BTC initially due to different investor bases and use cases. Current 'crypto market down' news with specific exchange/regulatory focus creates ideal conditions for temporary decoupling.
entry_conditions: Crypto-specific negative news headline (e.g., exchange issues, regulatory)
Overall crypto market cap decline <5% (avoid panic selling)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC-ETH correlation returns >0.8 or ratio returns to average ±0.5%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Correlation drops further to <0.4 or market cap declines >8%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Decoupling persists >72 hours or correlation breakdown becomes structural rather than temporary
